about.description: Specifies that the page is an 'about' page and which template to use when laying out the page.

subtitle.description: Identifies the subtitle of the document.

author.description: Author or authors of the document

affiliation.description: The list of organizations with which contributors are affiliated.

copyright.description: The copyright for this document, if any.

article.description: Information concerning the article that identifies or describes it.

journal.description: Information on the journal in which the article is published.

abstract-title.description: Title used to label document abstract

notes.description:
Additional notes concerning the whole article. Added to the
article's frontmatter via the [`<notes>`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/element/notes.html) element.

tags.description: List of keywords. Items are used as contents of the [`<kwd>`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/element/kwd.html) element; the elements are grouped in a [`<kwd-group>`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/element/kwd-group.html) with the [`kwd-group-type`](https://jats.nlm.nih.gov/publishing/tag-library/1.2/attribute/kwd-group-type.html) value `author`.

doi.description: Displays the document Digital Object Identifier in the header.

thanks.description: The contents of an acknowledgments footnote after the document title.

order.description: Order for document when included in a website automatic sidebar menu.

citation.description: Citation information for the document itself.

code-copy.description: Enable a code copy icon for code blocks.

code-link.description:
Enables hyper-linking of functions within code blocks 
to their online documentation.

code-annotations.description: The style to use when displaying code annotations

code-tools.description: Include a code tools menu (for hiding and showing code).

code-block-border-left.description: Show a thick left border on code blocks.

code-block-bg.description: Show a background color for code blocks.

highlight-style.description: Specifies the coloring style to be used in highlighted source code.

listings.description: Use the listings package for LaTeX code blocks.

indented-code-classes.description: Specify classes to use for all indented code blocks

linkcolor.description: Sets the color of hyperlinks in the document.

monobackgroundcolor.description: Sets the CSS `background-color` property on code elements and adds extra padding.

backgroundcolor.description: Sets the CSS `background-color` property on the html element.

filecolor.description: The color used for external links using color options allowed by `xcolor`

citecolor.description: The color used for citation links using color options allowed by `xcolor`

urlcolor.description: The color used for linked URLs using color options allowed by `xcolor`

toccolor.description: The color used for links in the Table of Contents using color options allowed by `xcolor`

colorlinks.description:
Add color to link text, automatically enabled if any of 
`linkcolor`, `filecolor`, `citecolor`, `urlcolor`, or `toccolor` are set.

contrastcolor.description: Color for links to other content within the document.

crossref.description: Configuration for cross-reference labels and prefixes.

crossrefs-hover.description: Enables a hover popup for cross references that shows the item being referenced.

scrolling.description: Use scrolling rather than fill layout (default: `false`)

nav-buttons.description: Links to display on the dashboard navigation bar

zotero.description:
Enable (`true`) or disable (`false`) Zotero for a document. Alternatively, provide a list of one or
more Zotero group libraries to use with the document.

type.description: Text describing the specialized type of this publication.

format.description: Text describing the format of this publication.

relation.description: Text describing the relation of this publication.

coverage.description: Text describing the coverage of this publication.

rights.description: Text describing the rights of this publication.

belongs-to-collection.description: Identifies the name of a collection to which the EPUB Publication belongs.

group-position.description:
Indicates the numeric position in which this publication 
belongs relative to other works belonging to the same 
`belongs-to-collection` field.

page-progression-direction.description: Sets the global direction in which content flows (`ltr` or `rtl`)

epub-metadata.description:
Look in the specified XML file for metadata for the EPUB.
The file should contain a series of [Dublin Core elements](https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dces/).

epub-subdirectory.description:
Specify the subdirectory in the OCF container that is to hold the
EPUB-specific contents. The default is `EPUB`. To put the EPUB 
contents in the top level, use an empty string.

epub-fonts.description: Embed the specified fonts in the EPUB

epub-chapter-level.description:
Specify the heading level at which to split the EPUB into separate
chapter files.

epub-cover-image.description:
Use the specified image as the EPUB cover. It is recommended
that the image be less than 1000px in width and height.

epub-title-page.description: If false, disables the generation of a title page.

engine.description: Engine used for executable code blocks.

freeze.description: Re-use previous computational output when rendering

daemon.description: Run Jupyter kernels within a peristent daemon (to mitigate kernel startup time).

daemon-restart.description: Restart any running Jupyter daemon before rendering.

ipynb.description: Execute code cell execution in Jupyter notebooks.

fig-width.description: Default width for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

fig-height.description: Default height for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

fig-format.description: Default format for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics (`retina`, `png`, `jpeg`, `svg`, or `pdf`)

fig-dpi.description: Default DPI for figures generated by Matplotlib or R graphics

fig-asp.description: The aspect ratio of the plot, i.e., the ratio of height/width.

fig-responsive.description: Whether to make images in this document responsive.

mainfont.description: Sets the main font for the document.

monofont.description: Sets the font used for when displaying code.

fontsize.description: Sets the main font size for the document.

fontenc.description: Allows font encoding to be specified through `fontenc` package.

fontfamily.description: Font package to use when compiling a PDF with the `pdflatex` `pdf-engine`.

fontfamilyoptions.description: Options for the package used as `fontfamily`.

sansfont.description: The sans serif font family for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.

mathfont.description: The math font family for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.

CJKmainfont.description: The CJK main font family for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.

mainfontoptions.description: The main font options for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.

sansfontoptions.description: The sans serif font options for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.

monofontoptions.description: The monospace font options for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.

mathfontoptions.description: The math font options for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.

font-paths.description: Adds additional directories to search for fonts when compiling with Typst.

CJKoptions.description: The CJK font options for use with `xelatex` or `lualatex`.

microtypeoptions.description: Options to pass to the microtype package.

linestretch.description: Sets the line height or spacing for text in the document.

interlinespace.description: Adjusts line spacing using the `\setupinterlinespace` command.

linkstyle.description: The typeface style for links in the document.

whitespace.description: Set the spacing between paragraphs, for example `none`, `small.

footnotes-hover.description: Enables a hover popup for footnotes that shows the footnote contents.

links-as-notes.description: Causes links to be printed as footnotes.

indenting.description: Set the indentation of paragraphs with one or more options.

adjusting.description: Adjusts text to the left, right, center, or both margins (`l`, `r`, `c`, or `b`).

hyphenate.description: Whether to hyphenate text at line breaks even in words that do not contain hyphens.

list-tables.description: If true, tables are formatted as RST list tables.

split-level.description:
Specify the heading level at which to split the EPUB into separate
chapter files.

funding.description:
Information about the funding of the research reported in the article 
(for example, grants, contracts, sponsors) and any open access fees for the article itself

defaults.description: Include options from the specified defaults files

request-headers.description: Headers to include with HTTP requests by Pandoc

fail-if-warnings.description: Exit with error status if there are any warnings.

dump-args.description: Print information about command-line arguments to *stdout*, then exit.

ignore-args.description: Ignore command-line arguments (for use in wrapper scripts).

file-scope.description: Parse each file individually before combining for multifile documents.

data-dir.description: Specify the user data directory to search for pandoc data files.

log-file.description: Write log messages in machine-readable JSON format to FILE.

track-changes.description:
Specify what to do with insertions, deletions, and comments produced by 
the MS Word “Track Changes” feature.

keep-source.description: Embed the input file source code in the generated HTML

keep-hidden.description: Keep hidden source code and output (marked with class `.hidden`)

prefer-html.description: Generate HTML output (if necessary) even when targeting markdown.

output-divs.description:
Indicates that computational output should not be written within divs. 
This is necessary for some formats (e.g. `pptx`) to properly layout
figures.

merge-includes.description:
Disable merging of string based and file based includes (some formats, 
specifically ePub, do not correctly handle this merging)

header-includes.description: Content to include at the end of the document header.

include-before.description: Content to include at the beginning of the document body (e.g. after the `<body>` tag in HTML, or the `\begin{document}` command in LaTeX).

include-after.description: Content to include at the end of the document body (before the `</body>` tag in HTML, or the `\end{document}` command in LaTeX).

include-before-body.description:
Include contents at the beginning of the document body
(e.g. after the `<body>` tag in HTML, or the `\begin{document}` command
in LaTeX).

A string value or an object with key "file" indicates a filename whose contents are to be included

An object with key "text" indicates textual content to be included

include-after-body.description:
Include content at the end of the document body immediately after the markdown content. While it will be included before the closing `</body>` tag in HTML and the `\end{document}` command in LaTeX, this option refers to the end of the markdown content.

A string value or an object with key "file" indicates a filename whose contents are to be included

An object with key "text" indicates textual content to be included

include-in-header.description:
Include contents at the end of the header. This can
be used, for example, to include special CSS or JavaScript in HTML
documents.

A string value or an object with key "file" indicates a filename whose contents are to be included

An object with key "text" indicates textual content to be included

resources.description: Path (or glob) to files to publish with this document.

headertext.description: Text to be in a running header.

footertext.description: Text to be in a running footer.

includesource.description: Whether to include all source documents as file attachments in the PDF file.

footer.description: Footer to include on all slides

lang.description: Identifies the main language of the document (e.g. `en` or `en-GB`).

language.description: YAML file containing custom language translations

dir.description: The base script direction for the document (`rtl` or `ltr`).

latex-auto-mk.description: Use Quarto's built-in PDF rendering wrapper

latex-makeindex-opts.description: Array of command line options for `makeindex`.

latex-tlmgr-opts.description: Array of command line options for `tlmgr`.

latex-output-dir.description: Output directory for intermediates and PDF.

latex-tinytex.description: Set to `false` to prevent an installation of TinyTex from being used to compile PDF documents.

latex-input-paths.description: Array of paths LaTeX should search for inputs.

papersize.description: The paper size for the document.

brand-mode.description: The brand mode to use for rendering the document, `light` or `dark`.

layout.description: The options for margins and text layout for this document.

page-layout.description: The page layout to use for this document (`article`, `full`, or `custom`)

page-width.description: Target page width for output (used to compute columns widths for `layout` divs)

grid.description: Properties of the grid system used to layout Quarto HTML pages.

appendix-style.description: The layout of the appendix for this document (`none`, `plain`, or `default`)

appendix-cite-as.description: Controls the formats which are provided in the citation section of the appendix (`false`, `display`, or `bibtex`).

title-block-style.description: The layout of the title block for this document (`none`, `plain`, or `default`).

title-block-banner.description: Apply a banner style treatment to the title block.

title-block-banner-color.description: Sets the color of text elements in a banner style title block.

title-block-categories.description: Enables or disables the display of categories in the title block.

max-width.description: Adds a css `max-width` to the body Element.

margin-left.description: Sets the left margin of the document.

margin-right.description: Sets the right margin of the document.

margin-top.description: Sets the top margin of the document.

margin-bottom.description: Sets the bottom margin of the document.

hyperrefoptions.description: Additional non-color options for the hyperref package.

indent.description: Whether to use document class settings for indentation.

block-headings.description: Make `\paragraph` and `\subparagraph` free-standing rather than run-in.

s5-url.description: The base url for s5 presentations.

slidy-url.description: The base url for Slidy presentations.

slideous-url.description: The base url for Slideous presentations.

lightbox.description: Enable or disable lightbox treatment for images in this document. See [Lightbox Figures](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-lightbox-figures.html) for more details.

link-external-icon.description: Show a special icon next to links that leave the current site.

link-external-newwindow.description: Open external links in a new browser window or tab (rather than navigating the current tab).

link-external-filter.description: A regular expression that can be used to determine whether a link is an internal link.

format-links.description: Controls whether links to other rendered formats are displayed in HTML output.

notebook-links.description: Controls the display of links to notebooks that provided embedded content or are created from documents.

other-links.description: A list of links that should be displayed below the table of contents in an `Other Links` section.

code-links.description: A list of links that should be displayed below the table of contents in an `Code Links` section.

notebook-subarticles.description: Controls whether referenced notebooks are embedded in JATS output as subarticles.

notebook-view.description: Configures the HTML viewer for notebooks that provide embedded content.

notebook-view-style.description: The style of document to render. Setting this to `notebook` will create additional notebook style affordances.

notebook-preview-options.description: Options for controlling the display and behavior of Notebook previews.

canonical-url.description: Include a canonical link tag in website pages

listing.description: Automatically generate the contents of a page from a list of Quarto documents or other custom data.

keywords.description: List of keywords to be included in the document metadata.

description.description: The document description. Some applications show this as `Comments` metadata.

license.description: The License for this document, if any. (e.g. `CC BY`)

title-meta.description: Sets the title metadata for the document

pagetitle.description: Sets the title metadata for the document

title-prefix.description:
Specify STRING as a prefix at the beginning of the title that appears in 
the HTML header (but not in the title as it appears at the beginning of the body)

description-meta.description: Sets the description metadata for the document

author-meta.description: Sets the author metadata for the document

date-meta.description: Sets the date metadata for the document

number-depth.description: The depth to which sections should be numbered.

secnumdepth.description: The numbering depth for sections. (Use `number-depth` instead).

number-offset.description: Offset for section headings in output (offsets are 0 by default)

section-numbering.description: Schema to use for numbering sections, e.g. `1.A.1`

shift-heading-level-by.description:
Shift heading levels by a positive or negative integer. For example, with 
`shift-heading-level-by: -1`, level 2 headings become level 1 headings.

pagenumbering.description: Sets the page numbering style and location for the document.

top-level-division.description:
Treat top-level headings as the given division type (`default`, `section`, `chapter`, or `part`). The hierarchy
order is part, chapter, then section; all headings are shifted such 
that the top-level heading becomes the specified type.

ojs-engine.description:
If `true`, force the presence of the OJS runtime. If `false`, force the absence instead.
If unset, the OJS runtime is included only if OJS cells are present in the document.

reference-doc.description:
Use the specified file as a style reference in producing a docx, 
pptx, or odt file.

brand.description:
Branding information to use for this document. If a string, the path to a brand file.
If false, don't use branding on this document. If an object, an inline brand
definition, or an object with light and dark brand paths or definitions.

theme.description: Theme name, theme scss file, or a mix of both.

body-classes.description: Classes to apply to the body of the document.

minimal.description: Disables the built in html features like theming, anchor sections, code block behavior, and more.

document-css.description: Enables inclusion of Pandoc default CSS for this document.

css.description: One or more CSS style sheets.

anchor-sections.description: Enables hover over a section title to see an anchor link.

smooth-scroll.description: Enables smooth scrolling within the page.

respect-user-color-scheme.description: Enables setting dark mode based on the `prefers-color-scheme` media query.

html-math-method.description: Method use to render math in HTML output

section-divs.description:
Wrap sections in `<section>` tags and attach identifiers to the enclosing `<section>`
rather than the heading itself.

identifier-prefix.description: Specify a prefix to be added to all identifiers and internal links.

email-obfuscation.description: Method for obfuscating mailto: links in HTML documents.

html-q-tags.description: Use `<q>` tags for quotes in HTML.

pdf-engine.description: Use the specified engine when producing PDF output.

pdf-engine-opt.description: Use the given string as a command-line argument to the `pdf-engine`.

pdf-engine-opts.description: Pass multiple command-line arguments to the `pdf-engine`.

beamerarticle.description: Whether to produce a Beamer article from this presentation.

beameroption.description: Add an extra Beamer option using `\setbeameroption{}`.

aspectratio.description: The aspect ratio for this presentation.

titlegraphic.description: The image for the title slide.

navigation.description: Controls navigation symbols for the presentation (`empty`, `frame`, `vertical`, or `horizontal`)

section-titles.description: Whether to enable title pages for new sections.

colortheme.description: The Beamer color theme for this presentation, passed to `\usecolortheme`.

colorthemeoptions.description: The Beamer color theme options for this presentation, passed to `\usecolortheme`.

fonttheme.description: The Beamer font theme for this presentation, passed to `\usefonttheme`.

fontthemeoptions.description: The Beamer font theme options for this presentation, passed to `\usefonttheme`.

innertheme.description: The Beamer inner theme for this presentation, passed to `\useinnertheme`.

innerthemeoptions.description: The Beamer inner theme options for this presentation, passed to `\useinnertheme`.

outertheme.description: The Beamer outer theme for this presentation, passed to `\useoutertheme`.

outerthemeoptions.description: The Beamer outer theme options for this presentation, passed to `\useoutertheme`.

themeoptions.description: Options passed to LaTeX Beamer themes inside `\usetheme`.

section.description: The section number in man pages.

variant.description: Enable and disable extensions for markdown output (e.g. "+emoji")

markdown-headings.description:
Specify whether to use `atx` (`#`-prefixed) or
`setext` (underlined) headings for level 1 and 2
headings (`atx` or `setext`).

ipynb-output.description: Determines which ipynb cell output formats are rendered (`none`, `all`, or `best`).

quarto-required.description: semver version range for required quarto version

preview-mode.description: The mode to use when previewing this document.

pdfa.description: Adds the necessary setup to the document preamble to generate PDF/A of the type specified.

pdfaiccprofile.description:
When used in conjunction with `pdfa`, specifies the ICC profile to use 
in the PDF, e.g. `default.cmyk`.

pdfaintent.description: When used in conjunction with `pdfa`, specifies the output intent for the colors.

bibliography.description: Document bibliography (BibTeX or CSL). May be a single file or a list of files

csl.description: Citation Style Language file to use for formatting references.

citations-hover.description: Enables a hover popup for citation that shows the reference information.

citation-location.description: Where citation information should be displayed (`document` or `margin`)

cite-method.description: Method used to format citations (`citeproc`, `natbib`, or `biblatex`).

biblatexoptions.description: A list of options for BibLaTeX.

natbiboptions.description: One or more options to provide for `natbib` when generating a bibliography.

biblio-style.description: The bibliography style to use (e.g. `\bibliographystyle{dinat}`) when using `natbib` or `biblatex`.

bibliographystyle.description: The bibliography style to use (e.g. `#set bibliography(style: "apa")`) when using typst built-in citation system (e.g when not `citeproc: true`).

biblio-title.description: The bibliography title to use when using `natbib` or `biblatex`.

biblio-config.description: Controls whether to output bibliography configuration for `natbib` or `biblatex` when cite method is not `citeproc`.

citation-abbreviations.description: JSON file containing abbreviations of journals that should be used in formatted bibliographies.

link-citations.description: If true, citations will be hyperlinked to the corresponding bibliography entries (for author-date and numerical styles only). Defaults to false.

link-bibliography.description: If true, DOIs, PMCIDs, PMID, and URLs in bibliographies will be rendered as hyperlinks.

notes-after-punctuation.description: Places footnote references or superscripted numerical citations after following punctuation.

output-ext.description: Extension to use for generated output file

template.description: Use the specified file as a custom template for the generated document.

template-partials.description: Include the specified files as partials accessible to the template for the generated content.

embed-resources.description: Produce a standalone HTML file with no external dependencies

self-contained.description: Produce a standalone HTML file with no external dependencies

self-contained-math.description: Embed math libraries (e.g. MathJax) within `self-contained` output.

filters.description:
Specify executables or Lua scripts to be used as a filter transforming
the pandoc AST after the input is parsed and before the output is written.

shortcodes.description: Specify Lua scripts that implement shortcode handlers

keep-md.description: Keep the markdown file generated by executing code

keep-ipynb.description: Keep the notebook file generated from executing code.

ipynb-filters.description: Filters to pre-process ipynb files before rendering to markdown

ipynb-shell-interactivity.description: Specify which nodes should be run interactively (displaying output from expressions)

plotly-connected.description:
If true, use the "notebook_connected" plotly renderer, which downloads
its dependencies from a CDN and requires an internet connection to view.

keep-typ.description: Keep the intermediate typst file used during render.

keep-tex.description: Keep the intermediate tex file used during render.

extract-media.description:
Extract images and other media contained in or linked from the source document to the
path DIR.

resource-path.description: List of paths to search for images and other resources.

default-image-extension.description: Specify a default extension to use when image paths/URLs have no extension.

abbreviations.description: Specifies a custom abbreviations file, with abbreviations one to a line.

dpi.description:
Specify the default dpi (dots per inch) value for conversion from pixels to inch/
centimeters and vice versa.

html-table-processing.description: If `none`, do not process tables in HTML input.

html-pre-tag-processing.description: If `none`, ignore any divs with `html-pre-tag-processing=parse` enabled.

use-rsvg-convert.description: If `true`, attempt to use `rsvg-convert` to convert SVG images to PDF.

scrollable.description: Allow content that overflows slides vertically to scroll

smaller.description: Use a smaller default font for slide content

output-location.description: Location of output relative to the code that generated it (`default`, `fragment`, `slide`, `column`, or `column-location`)

embedded.description: Flags if the presentation is running in an embedded mode

display.description: The display mode that will be used to show slides

auto-stretch.description: For slides with a single top-level image, automatically stretch it to fill the slide.

margin.description:
For `revealjs`, the factor of the display size that should remain empty around the content (e.g. 0.1).

For `typst`, a dictionary with the fields defined in the Typst documentation:
`x`, `y`, `top`, `bottom`, `left`, `right` (margins are specified in `cm` units,
e.g. `5cm`).

min-scale.description: Bounds for smallest possible scale to apply to content

max-scale.description: Bounds for largest possible scale to apply to content

disable-layout.description: Disables the default reveal.js slide layout (scaling and centering)

code-block-height.description: Sets the maximum height for source code blocks that appear in the presentation.

preview-links.description: Open links in an iframe preview overlay (`true`, `false`, or `auto`)

auto-play-media.description:
Autoplay embedded media (`null`, `true`, or `false`). Default is `null` (only when `autoplay` 
attribute is specified)

preload-iframes.description: Global override for preloading lazy-loaded iframes (`null`, `true`, or `false`).

view-distance.description: Number of slides away from the current slide to pre-load resources for

mobile-view-distance.description: Number of slides away from the current slide to pre-load resources for (on mobile devices).

parallax-background-horizontal.description: Number of pixels to move the parallax background horizontally per slide.

parallax-background-vertical.description: Number of pixels to move the parallax background vertically per slide.

history.description: Push each slide change to the browser history

touch.description: Enable touch navigation on devices with touch input

mouse-wheel.description: Enable slide navigation via mouse wheel

hide-cursor-time.description: Time before the cursor is hidden (in ms)

shuffle.description: Randomize the order of slides each time the presentation loads

controls.description: Show arrow controls for navigating through slides (`true`, `false`, or `auto`).

controls-tutorial.description: Help the user learn the controls by providing visual hints.

controls-back-arrows.description: Visibility rule for backwards navigation arrows (`faded`, `hidden`, or `visible`).

auto-slide.description: Automatically progress all slides at the specified interval

auto-slide-method.description: Navigation method to use when auto sliding (defaults to navigateNext)

default-timing.description: Expected average seconds per slide (used by pacing timer in speaker view)

pause.description: Flags whether it should be possible to pause the presentation (blackout)

help.description: Show a help overlay when the `?` key is pressed

hash.description: Add the current slide to the URL hash

hash-one-based-index.description: Use 1 based indexing for hash links to match slide number

respond-to-hash-changes.description: Monitor the hash and change slides accordingly

fragment-in-url.description: Include the current fragment in the URL

slide-tone.description: Play a subtle sound when changing slides

pdf-max-pages-per-slide.description: Slides that are too tall to fit within a single page will expand onto multiple pages

pdf-separate-fragments.description: Prints each fragment on a separate slide

pdf-page-height-offset.description: Offset used to reduce the height of content within exported PDF pages.

scroll-view.description: Control the scroll view feature of Revealjs

background-transition.description: Transition style for full page slide backgrounds

fragments.description: Turns fragments on and off globally

auto-animate-easing.description: Default CSS easing function for auto-animation

auto-animate-styles.description:
CSS properties that can be auto-animated (positional styles like top, left, etc.
are always animated).

incremental.description:
Make list items in slide shows display incrementally (one by one). 
The default is for lists to be displayed all at once.

slide-level.description:
Specifies that headings with the specified level create slides.
Headings above this level in the hierarchy are used to divide 
the slide show into sections.

slide-number.description: Display the page number of the current slide

show-slide-number.description: Contexts in which the slide number appears (`all`, `print`, or `speaker`)

title-slide-attributes.description: Additional attributes for the title slide of a reveal.js presentation.

title-slide-style.description: The title slide style. Use `pandoc` to select the Pandoc default title slide style.

show-notes.description: Make speaker notes visible to all viewers

rtl.description: Change the presentation direction to be RTL

df-print.description:
Method used to print tables in Knitr engine documents (`default`,
`kable`, `tibble`, or `paged`). Uses `default` if not specified.

wrap.description: Determine how text is wrapped in the output (`auto`, `none`, or `preserve`).

columns.description: For text formats, specify length of lines in characters. For `typst`, number of columns for body text.

tab-stop.description: Specify the number of spaces per tab (default is 4).

preserve-tabs.description: Preserve tabs within code instead of converting them to spaces.

strip-comments.description: Strip out HTML comments in source, rather than passing them on to output.

ascii.description: Use only ASCII characters in output.

toc.description: Include an automatically generated table of contents

toc-indent.description:
The amount of indentation to use for each level of the table of contents.
The default is "1.5em".

toc-depth.description:
Specify the number of section levels to include in the table of contents.
The default is 3

toc-title.description: The title used for the table of contents.

toc-expand.description: Specifies the depth of items in the table of contents that should be displayed as expanded in HTML output. Use `true` to expand all or `false` to collapse all.

lof.description: Print a list of figures in the document.

lot.description: Print a list of tables in the document.

search.description: Setting this to false prevents this document from being included in searches.

repo-actions.description:
Setting this to false prevents the `repo-actions` from appearing on this page.
Other possible values are `none` or one or more of `edit`, `source`, and `issue`, *e.g.* `[edit, source, issue]`.

aliases.description: URLs that alias this document, when included in a website.

image.description: The path to a preview image for this document.

image-height.description: The height of the preview image for this document.

image-width.description: The width of the preview image for this document.

image-alt.description: The alt text for preview image on this page.

image-lazy-loading.description: If true, the preview image will only load when it comes into view.

axe.description: When defined, run axe-core accessibility tests on the document.
